chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child

result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew D Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Incest with Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.06(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall have no contact with H.M.T. unless authorized by his Probation Agent. 
Defendant shall have no unsupervised contact with minors unless approved by his Probation Agent.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.
Defendant shall participate in sex offender treatment only is Probation Agent deems appropriate.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.
Defendant shall comply with sex offender registration.

timeConds.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.  Transfer is authorized to a jail convenient to Defendant's employment or residence.

records.addlTxt: Disposition Form

Defendant in person & by Atty. Wilfred P. de Junco.  Atty. Stephanie L. Hanson appeared for State.  Victim appears via telephone.  Resolution reached with defense free to argue on condition time.  State moves to dismiss and read in Ct. 1.  Court has colloquy with victim regarding her right to personally appear.  Guilty plea entered on Ct. 2.  Court finds Defendant guilty on Ct. 2 and orders Ct. 1 dismissed and read in.  Short recess to allow Court to review report.  Reconvene.  Court orders psychological report filed by defense to be sealed and executes order.  Argument by counsel.  Court proceeds to sentencing.
